title: There is not a single aspect on Kassadin which wasn't nerfed purely because of his mobility
body:
His mobility which already had its own huge drawbacks. Then he gets nerfed, and nerfed, and nerfed, and *nerfed* and then reworked to finally become unplayable. He's had his fucking *movespeed* nerfed at times.

But {{champion:429}} can dash every *auto attack* and {{champion:92}} gets 4 resourceless, low CD dashes, an AD scaling shield, and AoE knockup and stun, an AD and attack range steroid. Huge AD scalings. And an AoE execute.

But Kassadin gets to have mediocre mobility, which costs tons of mana, shit damage and pretty bad defenses. Seems fair.

replies.body:
"But he's an assassin"

Yeah, riven is basically a tanky assassin that has a knockup, stun, and a long ranged execute.

A kalista that rushes damage over movement speed has so much damage it's scary, and you still won't catch the bitch.
I don't get how Kass is even considered an assassin. You simply cannot just build straight damage like Talon or Katarina.

I think assassin can also be used to refer to the fact that the champion can chase really well, making it very hard to escape them or their damage.

Basically: he's classified as an assassin because Riot's simplified classing system has no idea where to place several champions, himself included. Other champions being Yi, Trynd, Yasuo, Nocturne and Fiora - of whom, two are classified as assassins primarily and fighters secondary (Master Yi and Nocturne) and 3 are Fighter primary and Assassin secondary (Tryndamere, Yasuo, Fiora). Despite the fact that they're largely treated as melee carries by the player-base and Riot themselves.

Nocturne is probably the most confusing of them because his kit wants him to play like both a dueling carry and a bruiser, but he can't do either particularly well. Likewise, Kassadin wants to burst, chase and possibly duel but also can't.

If we used DotA's classing system, he'd probably have the same classification as Slark: Escape. Because damn is he good at it, and his escape abilities can also be used offensively, similar to Slark. And like Slark, both are can be exceedingly difficult to lock down. Less assassin, more 'just plain mobile.'
Don't forget that Malzahar is considered an assassin. It's probably the lack of a "burst mage" title that forces them into that classification

The fact that Kass is still called an assassin is just a throwback to when he actually had significant burst. At this point, he is mostly a DPS mage since he relies on low cooldowns and sticking to targets rather than his old style of instantly appearing behind you, one-shotting you, and disappearing again.

"Riven is a tanky assassin"

I didn't realize building all DPS items made you a tank on a mechanic intensive champ.

mages in the meta? that's a funny joke.

The reason he kept getting nerfed is that he was riding on well over a year (maybe even two) of being perma-banned for his (then unparalleled) mobility on top of his (then insane) damage and his (then utterly oppressive) CC. He needed all the nerfs he's gotten, not because he was OP after the rework, but so that his longstanding reputation as *the* broken champion of League could die away and allow room for them to actually pull together a *real* rework in the future, not some half baked gutting. Right now we're just stuck in that period where any slight buff makes him suddenly seem like he's gonna become instantly OP, even when it won't, because his reputation is still lingering.

Saw one in the last hundred games.  He was utterly crushed.  Played him once in the last hundred games (separate game).  I was crushed, by a Teemo.  Kassadin's kit feels like Rito wanted him to face off against ranged AP based mages without significant auto attack/spell spam presence.  The issue I'm having is that for a melee champion, his base speed is slow, he has long cooldowns/E charge up, and his ultimate is very weak.  He is also very easily countered by AD based mages/assassins (Yorick is an AD mage), but has no ability to contend with top lane bruisers/tanks, nor any potential to be a jungler.  He's a gimped champion, plain and simple.  Specialized and weak as hell in the one role you're supposed to dominate in (let alone other roles) is a very bad game design.
